title: I cannot stand toxicity/int. feeding/afk
body:
EDIT: I love how some people have such an attitude with me. I didn't even do anything to anyone. Ya'll need to stop making me think I'm some kind of moron when I really am not. And no, I didn't know that muting wouldn't affect friends, so don't remind me, I already know now (thank you to Deep Terror Nami for explaining, I humbly apologize)

EDIT 2: Love how people are judging me for playing bot games instead of PvP and Ranked like the "normal players" do. Nice job guys. Nice community. I expected this community to not be so salty towards me, but of course I got the short end of the stick.

Luckily I haven't done any PVP games (yet, mainly cuz I still don't feel ready), but I am not happy with how players treat their team. 

To be honest, if I had a toxic player, I would just mute them until the game is over. I wouldn't speak to them, because it would make me toxic as well if I was toxic back.

Word to those who are being toxic back to a toxic player: DON'T. It will get you suspended.

Now, let's take a look at the int. feeders. Int. feeding just because someone banned your champion, for example. Yeah, don't do that. Int. feeding is a huge no-no. If I have an int. feeder in my team, they'll sure as hell regret it.

Word to int. feeders: STOP IT. Just don't do it.

Now the AFKers. AFKing because your team is losing or whatever will make your team lose even more.

Word to AFKers: No. Just don't do that. It will make the game feel like a complete hellhole.

You can always learn more tips and tricks with watching youtube videos and practicing what you learnt through bot games or custom games that way you're not trying something new in pvp and then you don't like the tip anymore, but generally you get some bad habits if you play bot games all the time so try mix it up a little bit :) use bots/customs for practicing new champs, new lanes or things you learn from people on youtube, go for people that generally have a higher positive view count, even watching LCS games helps sometimes, don't get stuck into watching off meta videos they're fun to watch but if you end up trying to do the same thing most times it won't work as your skill level won't be the same as theirs :) but good luck in your pvp i hope you have fun learning new things and new lanes as well, Arams are also good for quick games so you can learn champions abilities, there are so many champions out there to learn and always read the patch notes to see any buffs or debuffs as they generally affect champions alot or not at all, also alot of items have been changing as well as new items coming out which is great, the new patch coming soon which is the new runes and masteries is something to look forward to as well since it will give a chance for lower level people to be on par with higher  level people :), if you're unsure of a build for a certain champion you want to play you can always look up the champion build but make sure its by a high ranked player and as recent as possible! :) I hope you learn new things, and get good so one day you can play ranked :) took me a year to get comfortable before i did my rank just take your time and don't rage quit! also negativity is a big reason why alot of teams do lose so ignore the haters and keep playing, if you make mistakes learn from them and make it better next time Just remember its just a game ^_^!
